intro: Scabiosa breviseta, commonly known as the short-haired scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance.
